channel.title: Trade Mark Law on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Trade Mark Law on 0x000216

item.title: The EU General Court has declared Adidas' three-stripe trademark to be invalid.
item.description: Alexandros Antoniou, a legal expert from the University of Essex, analyzes a June 19, 2019, ruling by the EU General Court (GC) that invalidated Adidas’s trademark of three parallel stripes. The court upheld the EU Intellectual Property Office’s decision, which found the trademark too simplistic and lacking distinctiveness, both inherently and through use. Adidas’s trademark, registered on May 21, 2014, for apparel, footwear, and headgear, was challenged by Shoe Branding Europe BVBA in December 2014.
